Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower and rosette in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: painted decoration consisting of Athena to left (eye, part of spear and helmet with red crest lines with white dots and black dotted snake decoration on bowl).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by British School at Athens. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For another possible Athena, see British Museum 1888.0601.493.e. On her cult and iconography in Chios, see Graf 1985, 44-9 and Villing 1998, 147-68.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 98, p. 107, p. 282, no. 789, pl. 103)
Smith 2009 / East Greek Pottery in the Collection of the British School at Athens (p. 354, no. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0844) (phase 2)
